item.title: Monument Valley Tour
item.description: Explore the magnificent formations of Monument Valley with a local Navajo guide. You’ll travel by open-air vehicle through this iconic landscape along backcountry routes and restricted areas. The excursion covers sites such as the Mitten Buttes, John Ford's Point, Yeibichai, Three Sisters Spires, and Sun Eyes Arch and a live Navajo musical performance.

item.title: 2.5 Hours of Monument Valley's Backcountry 4×4 Tour
item.description: Explore Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park on this tour that introduces you to Monument Valley's major scenic attractions. During the journey, see backcountry monuments, which include arches and ancient petroglyphs from the Anasazi people. Select a morning or afternoon departure time when booking.

image.alt: 2.5 Hours of Monument Valley's Backcountry 4×4 Tour

item.title: 3.0 Hours of Monument Valley's Sunrise or Sunset 4×4 Tour
item.description: See the sites of Lower Monument Valley that even tour guides can’t get enough of on this 3-hour sunrise or sunset excursion. Guides custom create itineraries that feature their favorite points in the valley in addition to must-see formations, transporting you in an all-terrain vehicle to sites far off the beaten path.

image.alt: 3.0 Hours of Monument Valley's Sunrise or Sunset 4×4 Tour

item.title: Sunset Tour of Monument Valley
item.description: See Monument Valley at its most spectacular: as it is lit up by the setting sun. This tour is led by a Navajo guide and takes you into the backcountry, to places that are normally off limits to visitors. As well as seeing the sights, you'll dive into Indigenous culture with a Navajo rug weaving demonstration and performances.

item.title: Monument Valley Extended Backcountry Tour
item.description: Discover the natural wonders of Monument Valley on a tour led by a Navajo guide, who shows you the top sites such as Big Hogan and John Ford's Point as well as additional places not covered in shorter tours. As you travel 28 miles (45 km) through the tribal park, you'll learn a bit about Navajo culture and legends, see where movies have been filmed, and visit a traditional hogan (dwelling) to watch a rug-weaving demonstration.

item.title: Monument Valley Daytime Tour - 3 Hours - Navajo Spirit Tours
item.description: The only way to explore the inner workings of Monument Valley is with a Navajo guide—it also happens to be the best way. With this private tour, your born-and-raised guide will take you from fantastic buttes, spires, and mesas to natural arches, amphitheaters, and Anasazi petroglyphs. You’ll wander this sacred ground exploring its beauty, significance, history, and culture, walking away with a connection to the land that cannot be broken.

image.alt: Monument Valley Daytime Tour - 3 Hours - Navajo Spirit Tours

item.title: Monument Valley Backcountry Tour
item.description: This guided tour of Monument Valley promises a more rounded experience than most typical sightseeing tours. With a Navajo guide, you'll explore in the company of someone with deep knowledge of the land and culture. As well as seeing the famed landscapes, you'll experience a rug weaving demonstration, performances and a side to the valley that is usually off limits to most visitors.

item.title: 3-hour Private Tour
item.description: Explore the Canyon de Chelly area with a certified guide who is from the region to get an insider’s take on the history and sites. You will travel in a 4x4, and even visit your guide’s home, where the family members still live in the traditional Navajo way. Hear stories of canyon life, including weaving, ranching, and farming. This is a locally owned small business, so you will be supporting them.

item.title: 1.5 Hour Tour of Monument Valley's Loop Drive
item.description: Monument Valley draws nearly half a million visitors every year to its famous rock formations along the Utah and Arizona border. Hear the geologic history and ancient mythology behind these formations on a guided 1.5-hour tour of Valley Loop Drive, stopping at the Valley’s most famous landmarks and overlooks.

image.alt: 1.5 Hour Tour of Monument Valley's Loop Drive

item.title: Sunrise Tour of Monument Valley
item.description: Explore Monument Valley with someone who knows the land best. In the company of a Navajo guide, you will see Monument Valley at its best: as the rising sun casts its warm glow over the valley's towering sandstone masterpieces. Afterward, dive into Indigenous culture through music, crafts and more.

item.title: 3.5 Hours of Monument Valley's Cultural 4×4 Tour
item.description: Learn about Navajo culture and see the natural wonders of Monument Valley on this tour of lower Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park. Visit a hogan, a traditional Navajo dwelling, to watch a demonstration, and hear stories from a guide about this region. Select a morning or afternoon departure time when booking.

image.alt: 3.5 Hours of Monument Valley's Cultural 4×4 Tour

item.title: Dreamcatcher Evening Experience in Monument Valley
item.description: Enjoy an evening of Navajo culture and Monument Valley scenery on this tour led by a Navajo guide. First you'll take a 2.5-hour exploration of Monument Valley at sunset to admire its red rock formations. Then sit down to a traditional Navajo dinner at a location near Rain God Mesa, followed by a performance of Navajo dancing, music, and storytelling around a campfire.

image.alt: Dreamcatcher Evening Experience in Monument Valley

item.title: 3 hour Private Tour in Chinle
item.description:
Canyon de Chelly National Monument has over 2,700 archaeologcal sites located in the heart of the Navajo Nation. Guests will get to see the ruins tucked into sand stone alcoves and rock art such as petroglyphs and pictographs. Rock formations, fauna and floral provides a perfect backdrop to your tour.
At each site you will hear the symbolic interpretations of petroglyphs and rock art seen along their tour, including occupation dates, archaeology and associated prehistoric and historic events in the vicinity including associated oral histories.
All guides are Navajo and have strong ties to the canyon and will provide you with an experience that will last a lifetime.

item.title: Monument Valley 4x4 Tour
item.description: Explore the awe-inspiring vistas and larger-than-life landscapes of Monument Valley on this tour led by a Navajo guide. You'll travel through the tribal park to see red rock formations and other sights, such as John Ford's Point and the Ear of the Wind, and Artist's Point. Plus, learn a bit about Navajo culture as you visit the Big Hogan and watch your guide's musical demonstration.

item.title: 3.5 Hours Mystery Valley Navajo Spirit Tour
item.description: Monument Valley is inside the Navajo Nation Reservation and has parts that are not open to the public. On this small-group tour, explore the valley with local valley guides with intimate knowledge of Navajo customs and traditions. Visit ancient Anasazi dwellings, petroglyph sites, natural arches, and panoramic viewpoints, while learning about the Anasazi people and Navajo culture, history, and traditions.

image.alt: 3.5 Hours Mystery Valley Navajo Spirit Tour

item.title: 3.5-Hour Mystery Valley's 4×4 Tour
item.description: Accessible only on Navajo-led tours, Mystery Valley is less frequented than its counterpart of Monument Valley, but offers just as many rock formations and desert vistas. Discover the mysteries behind ancient Anasazi dwellings, petroglyphs, and all manner of buttes and arches on this 3.5-hour tour, fully narrated by your guide.

item.title: 2.5 HR Tour (3SNGT 2.5hr)
item.description: See the best of Monument Valley on this 2.5-hour tour covering about 28 miles (45 kilometers) of rough terrain. Meet your guide at the Monument Valley Visitor Center and head into the valley, visiting rock formations and movie locations while learning about Navajo culture and values. See Natural Arches, Anasazi ruins, and petroglyphs— there’s also an optional demonstration about Navajo weaving and wool dyeing traditions.

item.title: 2.5 Hours Monument Valley Historical Sightseeing Tour by Jeep
item.description: Discover Monument Valley in the comfort of a Jeep, with a local guide to drive you around the area and tell you all about the history of the valley and what life is like there on this small-group tour. Explore a 17-mile loop, including restricted backcountry, in the comfortable car and see way more than you would on foot.

image.alt: 2.5 Hours Monument Valley Historical Sightseeing Tour by Jeep

item.title: Full Valley Tour 2.5 Hrs.
item.description: Monument Valley is known for its red-sand desert land, its ancient Anasazi petroglyphs, and its photogenic sandstone rock formations, but the land is best understood by someone who lives there. This Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park Tour is led by someone who lives on the area that is territory of the Navajo Nation Reservation. See the full valley, including the restricted areas with your guide during this tour.

item.title: Blackwater Tours - Standard 1.5 Hour Tour - 2 Person Minimum
item.description: Drive the rugged landscape of Monument Valley in this guided tour. Marvel at the size of the sandstone megaliths and see landmarks that were made famous in old Western movies. Departing from the Visitor’s Center travel along the valley floor in an open vehicle or SUV. Stop at five of the monuments for which the valley is known to help develop a deeper appreciation for the area and its history.

image.alt: Blackwater Tours - Standard 1.5 Hour Tour - 2 Person Minimum

item.title: Monument Valley Stargazing Tour
item.description: The adventure begins with a brief introduction from your Navajo guide who will then embark you on an unforgettable journey into Monument Valley. Your guide will navigate you to where the stars are at their brightest. Enjoy the luxury of exploring the area and watch your guide bring the stars to life through story telling, and live performances. Behind the breathtaking Mesas, Buttes, Spires, and Arches; There are hidden stories waiting to be told.

item.title: 1.5 Hour Jeep Tour in Monument Valley
item.description: Generated for families and couples that have a constricted schedule, let us provide a narrated tour of Monument Valley in a judicious fashion! Covering the 17-mile loop, popular viewpoints with historical backgrounds.

image.alt: 1.5 Hour Jeep Tour in Monument Valley

item.title: Tour Monument Valley with a Navajo guide (3SNGT 1.5hr)
item.description: Monument Valley is located within Navajo Nation, also known as Navajoland, an American Indian reservation. With this small-group tour, explore the red-sand desert region with a Navajo guide born and raised in the valley and the surrounding areas. A team takes you through about 15 miles (24 kilometers) of rough terrain, sharing top sights and film locations, and Navajo traditions, history, and stories.

image.alt: Tour Monument Valley with a Navajo guide (3SNGT 1.5hr)

item.title: Private Monument Valley Tour
item.description:
Embark on an extraordinary journey through Monument Valley, a mesmerizing landscape of sandstone wonders and cinematic history. Join the legendary Don Mose, a charismatic 83-year-old Navajo guide, as he unveils the secrets of this sacred terrain, taking you beyond the ordinary tourist paths.
This exclusive tour offers access to restricted corners of the valley, revealing sandstone arches and iconic monuments that starred in John Wayne's epic westerns.
More than just breathtaking landscapes, this experience is a cultural immersion led by Don Mose. Enjoy the resonant melodies of Don's ceremonial songs as they echo through the canyon walls.
Don't just witness the scenery; immerse yourself in Don's enthralling storytelling, unveiling the rich tapestry of Navajo history and culture from the perspective of a respected native elder.
Don is more than a guide; he's a living embodiment of the Navajo spirit. His tales will linger in your heart long after the tour ends.
